blog.name: sylvansie
blog.title: The Escape Corner
blog.description: Where the images in my head go to live

body:
Traveler unease

Call me overly suspicious, but I don’t trust this Traveler entity that Jester’s been having conversations with.

Generally, any person that sneeks into a lonely child’s room in secret, gives them gifts and tells them that they’re “their favourite” gives me the willies on principle. The only thing redeeming him here is that he is OK with her having other friends.

Exandria-specifically, aren’t the gods supposed to have been sealed away behind the Divine Gate so that they cannot interfere directly with the Prime Material? You know, like Vox Machina spent a good chunk of their last story arc making sure would happen to Vecna?

I don’t doubt that the Traveler is a god. His worship is banned as we saw when items pertaining to him were mixed up in that cache of banned holy symbols the Mighty Nein found in the Merrow cave. I just doubt that the entity that’s been speaking to Jester is that god.

And now he mentioned sending her to a whole group of his cultists. I see this going three different ways:

a) Jester’s friend is an entity that is messing with the Traveler, and he has cultists too, and he’s sending her there for some nefarious purpose.

b) Jester’s friend is an entity that is messing with the Traveler, he’s sending her to mess with the Traveler’s cultists.

c) Jester’s friend is the Traveler, and she’s going to meet other lovely prankster Traveler-loving folk, and Matt is not playing the long game and I’m paranoid.

tags: ever since matt acknowledged this in a kind of positive light i felt like my brain was going to explode
summary: Ok I have to make this post or else I'm gonna lose it. The cr fandom absolutely needs to stop correlating Nott's...
body:
Ok I have to make this post or else I’m gonna lose it. The cr fandom absolutely needs to stop correlating Nott’s discomfort/hatred of herself and other goblins with gender dysphoria. It is a complete insult to every poc who has ever felt the same way about themselves and their culture. The rejection of one’s race because of internalized racism is a serious issue that affects people around the world, and pushes many to make dramatic changes to their body to get rid of racial features. This only leads to increased feelings of alienation, from themselves, as well as from others.

Coming from someone who is non-binary, I know what it’s like to look for scraps of your experience in media but this is NOT THAT EXPERIENCE. It is impossible to take an issue that is so completely based on race away from that context.

It is especially worrying to me to see certain people validating and supporting not only Nott’s desire to change her own race but also her desire to get rid of others like her.

I don’t know how Nott’s plot line is going to shake down but it would be absolutely heartbreaking for it to be resolved in the way that I think some of you want it to be, ie. Nott becoming a different race while continuing to believe that goblins are terrible and deserve to be exterminated.

Tldr: please use your brains for two seconds and realize that gender dysphoria and internalized racism are two very different things.

The rejection of one’s race because of internalized racism is a serious issue that affects people around the world, and pushes many to make dramatic changes to their body to get rid of racial features. Coming from someone who is non-binary, I know what it’s like to look for scraps of your experience in media but this is NOT THAT EXPERIENCE. It is impossible to take an issue that is so completely based on race away from that context.

summary: Hey, y’know what’s not funny anymore? That thing Sam said in episode 3, after Molly had just been the first player KO of the...
body:
Hey, y’know what’s not funny anymore?

That thing Sam said in episode 3, after Molly had just been the first player KO of the game - “Well, seeing one of us die scares Nott-” “Unconscious.” “Nope, dead forever.”

summary: Every Critical Role Fanartist is a Coward
title: Every Critical Role Fanartist is a Coward
body:
Creative

One hundred percent talented

Worthy of so much recognition

An amazing aspect of the community

Radical no matter the headcanon

Draw whatever you want to draw I love and admire every single one of you

summary: there were a lot of Good Moments in episode 31, but my personal fave was when Fjord and Beau were talking about punching ghosts...
body:
there were a lot of Good Moments in episode 31, but my personal fave was when Fjord and Beau were talking about punching ghosts and Caduceus just blanked out of the conversation looking Intensely Focused for like a whole minute, presumably going through the full list of ghosts he had met and whether or not he had wanted to punch them before answering, by which time they had moved on to a different topic of conversation

like. I love Taliesin’s characterisation of Caduceus a lot, and this kind of thing is the reason for it

summary:
Campaign 1 | Episode 41 - In Ruins
Vox Machina has just found a gravely injured Gilmore. After being healed, somewhat, Gilmore...
body:
Campaign 1 | Episode 41 - In Ruins

Vox Machina has just found a gravely injured Gilmore. After being healed, somewhat, Gilmore manages to look up at Vax, and says:

“It’s always what I assumed I’d see in my last moments.”

And it’s so poetic. Because now it’s true. When Gilmore dies I have little doubt Vax will be there to greet him.
